questions.question: She ………………… speak Italian really well.
questions.description: We use can to talk about ability.

questions.question: I asked if you ………………………….. arrive in the afternoon.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause. Could is the past tense of can.

questions.question: She ………………………… walk when she was just nine months old.
If you take rest for an hour, you ……………………… feel better.
questions.description: All of these can be used to talk about possibility in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: After giving birth, a woman ……………………. suffer from depression for many months.
questions.description: May is often used to talk about typical occurrences.

questions.question: She said that she ………………………….. go to the movies.
questions.description: Might is the past tense of may.

questions.question: You …………………………… have lots of money, but that doesn’t mean you are better than me.
When I was a child, I …………………………. watch TV whenever I wanted.
questions.description: We use could to talk about past ability.

questions.question: I ………………………. be happy even if I do not win the prize.
questions.description: Will is used to make predictions about the future.

questions.question: She …………………………… be here soon.
questions.description: We often use should to talk about logical possibility.

questions.question: I …………………………….. kill him if he reads my letters again.
